name: Irene Mulvey
content:
Irene Mulvey is an American mathematician.
 Mulvey completed her doctoral dissertation, titled Periodic, Recurrent and Non-Wandering Points for Continuous Maps of the Circle at Wesleyan University in 1982, where she was advised by Ethan Coven.[1] She was appointed to a professorship at Fairfield University in 1985.[2] In July 2020, Mulvey was elected president of the American Association of University Professors, succeeding Rudy Fichtenbaum.[3]
 
 This article about an American mathematician is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
raw:
American mathematician
Irene Mulvey is an American mathematician.
Mulvey completed her doctoral dissertation, titled Periodic, Recurrent and Non-Wandering Points for Continuous Maps of the Circle at Wesleyan University in 1982, where she was advised by Ethan Coven.[1] She was appointed to a professorship at Fairfield University in 1985.[2] In July 2020, Mulvey was elected president of the American Association of University Professors, succeeding Rudy Fichtenbaum.[3]

References[edit]


^ Irene Mulvey at the Mathematics Genealogy Project

^ "Fairfield Professor Irene Mulvey, PhD, Elected AAUP President". Fairfield University. August 2020. Retrieved October 12, 2020.

^ Flaherty, Colleen (July 22, 2020). "AAUP Announces Election Results". Inside Higher Ed. Retrieved October 12, 2020.
